body: @weisong44 : Looks like there are some merge conflicts? Can you fix it too? otherwise, looks good to merge

fix merge conflicts, and move yarn section to the "deployments/" directory?

Thanks for adding this. Would prefer to not tie changelogs to Kafka, esp. in the API. Also, now that we have StreamDescriptors, I think it'll be better to accept a StreamDescriptor for the changelog (i.g., withChangelog(OutputStreamDescriptor). This way users can configure these system specific properties (replication.factor, cleanup.policy etc) on the stream itself, which makes more sense. What do you think?

Thanks for the review @nickpan47 and @cameronlee314. I'm discarding these changes for now. I think a better direction would be to removed the no-serde variants of operators that create intermediate streams. Will submit another PR.

@prateekm : merged and submitted, thanks!

@weisong44 We are updating the public APIs for task/container contexts, so the old TaskContext/SamzaContainerContext no longer exist. Now there is a single Context API which can be used to get to any context information, and we are updating the old context usages to use the new API.
Since there is currently no support for container-level tables, that check is being removed in this PR to keep the implementation clean. Once there is a concrete support for container-level tables, we can discuss how to add that check back in (e.g. maybe instead of passing null context objects, there is a different constructor and/or a config).
merged and submitted. @prateekm and @shanthoosh.

Thanks for the work. Agree that we should deprecate the stream.list config. But once we make that change, we need to make sure Brooklin connector adjust to that change as well. Also Brooklin EventHubs connector should use these descriptors.
This PR includes the code changes of https://github.com/apache/samza/pull/691. After https://github.com/apache/samza/pull/691 is merged, I will update this PR to remove those code changes.

To make this PR smaller, I've made another PR #691 which includes all the code change of the first part mentioned in the PR description. After #691 is merged, I will update this PR to contain the second part only.

@prateekm 
please take a look when you get a chance. I verified that this unblocks the internal build problems.

@shanthoosh It's not OK to change existing licenses on third party dependencies and replace them with Apache license. Also, I'm not sure why adding a few files to rat excludes causes this failure. Let's debug more, and close this PR for now.

@Sanil15 

Currently `TestRunner` API creates the RocksDB state relative to the main samza  directory. For whatever reason, if the RocksDB state is not cleaned up from a test run then the subsequent ./gradlew build will fail with the following rat exception: 
```
:rat
Rat report: build/rat/rat-report.html
Unknown license: /home/svenkata/code/samza/samza-1/samza/samza-test/logged/profile-table/Partition_0/000003.log
Unknown license: /home/svenkata/code/samza/samza-1/samza/samza-test/logged/profile-table/Partition_0/CURRENT
Unknown license: /home/svenkata/code/samza/samza-1/samza/samza-test/logged/profile-table/Partition_0/IDENTITY
Unknown license: /home/svenkata/code/samza/samza-1/samza/samza-test/logged/profile-table/Partition_0/LOCK
Unknown license: /home/svenkata/code/samza/samza-1/samza/samza-test/logged/profile-table/Partition_0/LOG
Unknown license: /home/svenkata/code/samza/samza-1/samza/samza-test/logged/profile-table/Partition_0/OPTIONS-000005
:rat FAILED
```

To fix, we can set the RocksDB state store base directory as `/tmp` for both logged and non-logged stores.

@vjagadish1989 @cameronlee314 @nickpan47 Please take a look. Would prefer to merge this in time for 1.0 (unless there are correctness issues) and fix forward with any minor changes.

PS: I'd strongly prefer to disable checkstyle unused imports checks that get triggered due to javadoc references in samza-api. The fully qualified class names make the docs difficult to read. Will do that in a follow up PR after 1.0.
@prateekm Could you please clarify what you will do in the follow up PR? I'm a bit unclear on what the proposed long-term state is.

Oh, I think I see what you are proposing now. So for this PR, you have the fully qualified class names, but your follow up is to remove the fully qualified class names and then disable checkstyle. Is that right?
merged and submitted. Thanks @Sanil15 for the contribution and @shanthoosh for reviews!
I'm not opposed to disabling checkstyle for unused imports for samza-api only, so that we don't need to use fully qualified class names.

@shanthoosh what prompted this change?

@prateekm 

When fixing SAMZA-1638, I noticed that the container threadPool in AsyncRunLoop was not shutdown at all.

Container thread pool is used to run window, commit, timer tasks in ` AsyncRunLoop`.  This will cause problems in standalone in the following scenario:

1. Due to a rebalance phase, `StreamProcessor` shuts down the `SamzaContainer`. 
2. `StreamProcessor` receives a new `JobModel` (v2) and starts the `SamzaContainer` again.
3. Window, commit tasks from the unstopped container thread pool corresponding to  previous JobModel(v1) would still be running in the JVM.

I think this can cause duplicate processing  depending upon number of window tasks scheduled in the container threadPool before `AsyncRunLoop` shutdown. 

Please correct me if I'm missing something here.
Does SamzaContainer.shutdownTask() shut them down?
@shanthoosh I understand, was just asking if you noticed any specific issues that lead to this change. Why is this closed? Is this not an issue anymore?
Super-seeded by  https://github.com/apache/samza/pull/796/files
